page.title: 02MONKTON FARLEIGH MANOR
page.content: Some of us went to meet {Sir Charles {Hobhouse}at{Monkton Farleigh Manor. Sir Charles owns the Manor and a lot of{land and houses}in the village. He has lived in the Manor for{30 years and his family has lived there for over 100 years. A{Monastery}was built on the site in 1125.You can see remains of the Monastery and the{Monks {Conduit.}This was a{well}for the {Cluniac Monks}and still provides water for the Manor and for some of the houses in the village today.There are{tombstones of crusaders}close to the ruined walls of the refectory.Sir Charles owns about{500 acres}of land around the Manor and this includes 300 acres of woodland.The rest of the land is used for{farmland- }arable and cattle grazing.{Ten people}work on the farm, Manor grounds and in the house.
